purpose: The email announces three upcoming full-time faculty positions in the Computer Science department at UCLouvain, Belgium, specifically targeting candidates in software engineering and cybersecurity. It encourages recipients to forward the information to high-profile candidates seeking permanent positions at a prestigious university in Europe. The email outlines the areas of expertise sought for the positions, highlights the benefits of working at UCLouvain, and provides details on the application process and timeline.

evidence_sentences: The Computer Science department at UCLouvain (Belgium) will soon open three full-time faculty positions targeting excellent profiles in the following domains.
Positions 1 and 2, in one or more of these areas: Software engineering, Programming systems and languages, Software dependability, including formal methods.
Position 3, in software security and cybersecurity, also broadly construed.
The three positions will be open to all seniority levels (assistant/associate or full).
A vibrant work environment just south of Brussels.
Moderate teaching load and access to excellent students.
No need to speak French to apply (but willingness to learn in a few years if appointed).
We expect vacancies to be announced on the UCLouvain job portal in early September, with a deadline a few weeks later for a standard application package.
